unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26, 2023 – The Indian sporting landscape is abuzz with activity, but recent weeks have also seen a flurry of injury concerns impacting key athletes across various disciplines. Here's a detailed breakdown of the latest injury updates:

unnormalised: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has confirmed that Hardik Pandya sustained a left ankle injury during the recent World Cup match against Bangladesh at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune on Oct 19, 2023. Initial reports suggest a Grade 2 sprain. He is currently undergoing rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. His participation in the remaining World Cup matches remains uncertain, a significant blow considering his all-round prowess. Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah is reported to be managing a niggle in his right shoulder but is expected to be fit for the upcoming clash against New Zealand. The team management is keen to avoid any further strain on Bumrah, a vital cog in India's bowling attack.

unnormalised: The Indian Men's Hockey team suffered a setback ahead of the Asian Champions Trophy with midfielder Manpreet Singh experiencing a hamstring strain during training. Doctors are monitoring him closely. Although sources say he should be match-fit soon, he has to undergo further check-ups. Defender Harmanpreet Singh, while cleared to play, is still recovering from a knock sustained earlier in the Pro League.

unnormalised: PV Sindhu is gradually recovering from the knee injury she sustained at the Commonwealth Games last year. Her next major tournament is scheduled to be the Syed Modi International Badminton Championships in Lucknow in January 2024.
